description: [Status: preview] [Name: loop-iterator-mutation] [Message: Mutation to loop iterable {name} during iteration] What it does Checks for mutations to an iterable during a loop iteration. Why is this bad? When iterating over an iterable, mutating the iterable can lead to unexpected behavior, like skipping elements or infinite loops. Example items = [1, 2, 3] for item in items: print(item) # Create an infinite loop by appending to the list. items.append(item)
